title: 00.Login
name: Login
description:
DXC web services use KeyCloak for OAuth2 (more information here). Call this KeyCloak API first to login with your valid system service account credentials (see here on how to get credentials). Securely cache the Access Token and Refresh Token returned in this response for use in subsequent DXC API requests. Note the time your obtained the Access Token and the returned expires_in value to calculate the expiration time of this access token. On all subsequent API requests with DXC, pass along the Access Token in the HTTP Authorization header field. Be sure to refresh your Access Token with the Refresh API request before it expires.

Service Provided by KeyCloak

examples.title: OAuth2 Request
examples.content:
POST /auth/realms/dxc-externals/protocol/openid-connect/token HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: curl/7.19.7 (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu)
Host: imr-ca-sandbox.maxird.com
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 90

grant_type=password&client_id=dxc&username=service.zesty2@maxird.com&password=S0m3P@wOrd

examples.title: OAuth2 Response
examples.content:

X-Powered-By: Undertow/1
Server: WildFly/10

Content-Length: 3847
Date: Wed, 17 Aug 2016 19:13:04 GMT

Number of seconds until access token expires

JWT Refresh Token (required to obtain a new access token)

title: 01.Refresh
name: Refresh
description:
This KeyCloak service is called to obtain a new Access Token before the current one expires. After calling this refresh service, applications should retain (and sufficiently secure the new Access Token returned in this response and use it in subsequent DXC API calls inplace of the prior Access Token. Failing to refresh an Access Token will result in DXC rejected requests with Access Denied once the Access Token has expired. For security reasons its preferable that applications login only as often as necessary and rely on this refresh mechanism to obtain new Access Tokens rather than issue login request more frequently.

Service Provided by KeyCloak

examples.title: OAuth2 Request
examples.content:
POST /auth/realms/dxc-externals/protocol/openid-connect/token HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: curl/7.19.7 (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu)
Host: imr-ca-sandbox.maxird.com
Content-Length: 1263
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Expect: 100-continue

grant_type=refresh_token&client_id=dxc&refresh_token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9..AQlRqa3ZNd7tv1Lb5qfw9Cl1F1WYG6XJs5FPBy8rr7W_q4676Ias2Ew5u8k9exlmrJhqWvMdY85tzBrVhNq4So3ZGzG084v0t2F1n4LX9w1kyo1q6ka-6nhiATwJC0wVHy0q-RjCSMElr2j5z3oxKO4LyT37123sRNZ4pOs1vA2D-ddEOX980NdVsyqX_MBW9p4OPC9esY0jZYXRX1svmcidyB6wj26vgpg9V-xiec3qxJuYLz8kHbtaa4jtVlEB-eKr_ZhWzl4x04lY6VtQ_G5pxEq04R1JQWHgI0befkdwcA1ut005OdablGmp3g_Hbmh07cdz0_HaKFo-yWD63A

title: 00.Search
name: SearchCases
description:
Overview

Conducts a search across all cases in your realm. You can search by IMRID, CAID or an array of statuses.

Paging

When search results get large, DXC searches provide a paging mechanism. To page through a result set, simply pass start and limit parameters as part of the search request. For example to get just the first 10 results, specify a start=0&limit=10. To get the next 10 results send start=10&limit=10. Its always a good idea to also include some sort criteria when using paging. For example to see the ten most recent changes to the cases in your realm use: {"start":0,"limit":10,"sort":[{"property":"modificationDate","desc":true}]}. For large result sets, paging is strongly encouraged and may be enforced in the future.

Output Formats

This API request can provide repsonses in either JSON or CSV. The response format is determined by the Accept HTTP header ("application/json" for JSON and "text/plain" for CSV). When returning CSV only the results array is returned in CSV format (matchCount, start and limit are not included). Additionally (as demonstrated in the sample CSV Response), some fields may contain embedded line breaks. These fields will be enclosed in quotes. This behavior may cause some records to span multiple lines.

Header.description: application/json (for JSON response) or text/plain (for CSV response)

Parameter.description: The index of the search results you wish returned. If not supplied or invalid it will be replaced with 0.

The number of results to return. If not supplied the specific API will select the maximum results to return. If the value is considered too large by the specific API it may alter this value in the response and ignore the supplied value.

examples.title: Search Request
examples.content:
POST /apigw/webservices/rest/apigw/cases/search HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: curl/7.19.7 (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu)
Host: imr-ca-sandbox.maxird.com
Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9..IGnhJCaUpBMZ-f5ZScnzJcNfnTLuaA0KsYYkdyQMMgGMd_wAj1d5SoVfsYd_vQkaSUyueqoRNApLFwv3BtkXDzyOLKBGGWl24Rmrt1-6pdSNOCpWkZmraFx4x9DfR7mSK13ucEvH35S1O_b9C41_96s_zH27ss9yTp_Q-G_rBvllAEbBu-rKk9ug0HzTNwlIyvg9g8AIgOZZUO8jB0Cu8Y0OjgQzdJwmw-zktmQhq5jf3R_1z--Syoe3m4gZbVG_SFJf3i06VG3rkMCED3AUr7yrXAOseaPkDBdQnoF7ActcHZxZDhB7CBwoyBL6WhekN7Mq38W87H01nLz8AOALIg
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
Content-Length: 51

{"start":0,"limit":25,"sort":[{"property":"dateOfInjury","desc":false}]}

Success 200.description:
Numeric strings sent with following meanings
  • 1 - Received
  • 2 - Eligibility Review
  • 3 - Records Requested
  • 4 - Clinical Review
  • 5 - Closed
  • 6 - NOARFI
  • 7 - Insufficient Records
Total number of cases matching search request Not sent with CSV responses
The index of the search results you wish returned. If not supplied or invalid it will be replaced with 0. Not sent with CSV responses

The number of results to return. If not supplied the specific API will select the maximum results to return. If the value is considered too large by the specific API it may alter this value in the response and ignore the supplied value. Not sent with CSV responses

Header.description: application/json (for JSON response) or text/plain (for CSV response)

Success 200.description:
Numeric strings sent with following meanings
  • 1 - Received
  • 2 - Eligibility Review
  • 3 - Records Requested
  • 4 - Clinical Review
  • 5 - Closed
  • 6 - NOARFI
  • 7 - Insufficient Records
Total number of cases matching search request Not sent with CSV responses
The index of the search results you wish returned. If not supplied or invalid it will be replaced with 0. Not sent with CSV responses

The number of results to return. If not supplied the specific API will select the maximum results to return. If the value is considered too large by the specific API it may alter this value in the response and ignore the supplied value. Not sent with CSV responses

title: 03.Download
name: DownloadDoc
description: This service allows downloading files for cases you are authorized to view. In production, these files will likely contain PHI and the recieving application is cautioned to take appropriate security measures. Please note that the handle parameter will likely contain a forward slash character '/' (e.g. a handle may look like: 20.5000.214/6baef007ce0dd9b9d61d). Since handles are sent as part of the request path, it might be tempting to URL encode them prior to building the path. Please DON'T do this. See the GET at the begining of the example to see how the serice should be called.

Parameter.description:
the handle of the particular document rendering requested
(sent in path - do not encode)

examples.title: Request
examples.content:
GET /apigw/webservices/rest/apigw/docs/download/20.5000.214/6baef007ce0dd9b9d61d HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: curl/7.19.7 (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu)
Host: imr-ca-sandbox.maxird.com
Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9..GY7utwi53CcjEDVPGoJJZAqSa-MiewayZl06gpb8qp96oZ1mW4Rz2NBEIR8V4z1zeOtWZYbdYXfkhYk4nWNc2Y8FXi-YNYHxm_SSNGCl1nzXljzthfCX-_oQ6CoKX8JeZa-J57Y4DXHdSwp14mkGVvWn4hnnHkjilAAqDh_5YbNwdijiw7w9DEyMyCR3OEFLXYgvICYXRYoQjjdSVQw2PKKKVa1xmkjOtnqjodKmijCFB4gJtmh1QUssleZK8X64acAMDU-tn5w2IlVrt-2vWKu3Kz2FNApbAOxa6rgJpl_dgRIhdO0NAfMkmztINjSMG6Cdxxh8X3FhINthyRB_FA

examples.title: Response
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Date: Fri, 19 Aug 2016 05:36:22 GMT
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Transfer-Encoding: chunked

Parameter.description: IMR Case Number (sent in path)
IMR Case Number (sent in path)

examples.title: Response
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
X-Frame-Options: DENY
Date: Sun, 21 Aug 2016 04:22:26 GMT
Content-Type: application/json
Transfer-Encoding: chunked

{"status":200,"msg":"OK"}

title: 02.Upload (legacy)
name: UploadDocLegacy
description: For legacy MOVEit users. The IMR case id is inferred from the file name.

Parameter.description: file name (must be of a recognized format such as: {IMRCaseNumber}_{NNN}.pdf)
